static convert(val, unit, axis)¶

convert obj using unit for the specified axis. If obj is a sequence, return the converted sequence. The output must be a sequence of scalars that can be used by the numpy array layer

faulttolerance.decomposition.tools.ghz_correction module¶

Functions to apply the required corrections when generating GHZ states under the different numbers of Bell pairs and GHZ sizes.

author: Eduardo Villasenor created-on: 02/05/18

faulttolerance.decomposition.tools.ghz_correction.correction(measurements, ghz_size, N, operation_pos)¶

Correction operations necesary given the result of the measurements and the GHZ state size.

measuements : (int) Measurements results of the collaped ancillas ex. [0, 1, 1, 0]. N : (int) system size. operation_pos : (list) position of qubit(s) in which the corrections apply.

faulttolerance.decomposition.tools.ghz_correction.correction_ghz3(measurements, N, operation_pos)¶

Correction opertions for the GHZ state of size 3. On the case when 3 bell pairs are collapsed into the GHZ.

faulttolerance.decomposition.tools.ghz_correction.correction_ghz4(measurements, N, operation_pos)¶

faulttolerance.decomposition.tools.names module¶

Functions to generate the names of the data to be used. The purpose of using this functions is to set a standard name system.

author: Eduardo Villasenor created-on: 20/01/18

faulttolerance.decomposition.tools.names.chi(ps, pm, pg, eta, a0, a1, theta, stab_size, parity, protocol)¶

Name generator for CHI matrix file outputs.

faulttolerance.decomposition.tools.names.ghz(ps, pm, pg, eta, a0, a1, theta, size, protocol)¶

Name generator for saved GHZ states.

faulttolerance.decomposition.tools.names.ghz_times(ps, pm, pg, eta, a0, a1, theta, size, protocol)¶

Name generator for saved GHZ states.

faulttolerance.decomposition.tools.operations module¶

Routines to perform basic operations not supplied by qutip already.

author: Eduardo Villaseñor created-on: 05/06/17

faulttolerance.decomposition.tools.operations.collapse_single_Xbasis_ket(psi, project, N=1, pos=0, dimRed=False)¶

Collapse the state in the postion of a single qubit in X basis.

faulttolerance.decomposition.tools.operations.collapse_single_Zbasis(rho, project, N=1, pos=0, dimRed=False)¶

Collapse the state in the postion of a single qubit.

faulttolerance.decomposition.tools.operations.collapse_single_Zbasis_ket(psi, project, N=1, pos=0, dimRed=False)¶

Collapse the state in the postion of a single qubit in Z basis.

faulttolerance.decomposition.tools.operations.forced_measure_single_Xbasis(rho, N=1, pos=0, project=0, dimRed=False)¶

Measure a single qubit in the X basis.

rho : (densmat) density matrix. N : (int) system size. pos : (int) position of qubit to be measured. project : (0, 1) the basis state to which the state collapses. dimRed : (bool) is the collapsed state has reduced to the

dimentions N - 1
faulttolerance.decomposition.tools.operations.forced_measure_single_Zbasis(rho, N=1, pos=0, project=0, dimRed=False)¶

Force a measurement on a single qubit in the Z basis to a given proyetor.

rho : (densmat) density matrix. N : (int) system size. pos : (int) position of qubit to be measured. project : (0, 1) force the measurement into the desired projector dimRed : (bool) is the collapsed state has reduced to the

dimentions N - 1
faulttolerance.decomposition.tools.operations.p_measurement_single_Xbasis(rho, measure, N=1, pos=0)¶

Calculate the probability of measuring the value “measure” on the X basis. Parameters ———- rho : (densmat) density matrix. measure : (0, 1) measurement result probability. pos : (int) position of qubit to be measured.

faulttolerance.decomposition.tools.operations.p_measurement_single_Zbasis(rho, measure, N=1, pos=0)¶

Calculate the probability of measuring the value “measure” on the Z basis.

rho : (densmat) density matrix. measure : (0, 1) measurement result probability. pos : (int) position of qubit to be measured.

faulttolerance.decomposition.tools.operations.projector_single_qubit_Xbasis(project, N=1, pos=0)¶
faulttolerance.decomposition.tools.operations.projector_single_qubit_Zbasis(project, N=1, pos=0)¶
faulttolerance.decomposition.tools.operations.projector_single_qubit_Zbasis_dimRed(project, N=1, pos=0)¶
faulttolerance.decomposition.tools.operations.random_measure_single_Xbasis(rho, N=1, pos=0, dimRed=False)¶

Measure a single qubit in the X basis.

rho : (densmat) density matrix. N : (int) system size. pos : (int) position of qubit to be measured. dimRed : (bool) is the collapsed state has reduced to the

dimentions N - 1
faulttolerance.decomposition.tools.operations.random_measure_single_Zbasis(rho, N=1, pos=0, dimRed=False)¶

Measure a single qubit in the Z basis, using a random number to choose a measurement outcome.

rho : (densmat) density matrix. N : (int) system size. pos : (int) position of qubit to be measured. dimRed : (bool) is the collapsed state has reduced to the

dimentions N - 1
faulttolerance.decomposition.tools.operations.tensor_operator(operators, positions, N)¶

Tensor the product of multiple single qubit operators.

operators : (list) operator list to be tensored. N : (int) total system dimension. positions : list with the positions for each operator.

faulttolerance.decomposition.tools.operations.tensor_single_operator(operator, N, pos)¶

Tensor a single qubit operator between identyties accoring to the position of the qubit and the system size.

operator : (operator) operatior to be tensored. N : (int) total system dimension. pos : (int) position inside the entire system to be measured.

faulttolerance.decomposition.tools.operations_test module¶

Routines test the functions in operations.py.

author: Eduardo Villaseñor created-on: 05/06/17

Obtain a global_phase between the two operators.

faulttolerance.decomposition.tools.p_success module¶

Functions to calculate the success probability of certain protocols. Relies in ‘projectors.py’ and ‘operations.py’ to generate the required projectors.

author: Eduardo Villaseñor created-on: 16/01/18

faulttolerance.decomposition.tools.p_success.double_sel(rho, N, ancillas_pos1, ancillas_pos2)¶

Return the success probability of the single selection protocol for entanglement distillment.

rho : (densmat) density matrix. N : (int) system size. ancilla_pos : (int) position of qubit to be measured.

faulttolerance.decomposition.tools.p_success.epl(rho, N, ancillas_pos)¶

Return the success probability of the single selection protocol for entanglement distillment.

rho : (densmat) density matrix. N : (int) system size. ancilla_pos : (int) position of qubit to be measured.

faulttolerance.decomposition.tools.p_success.ghz_3(rho)¶

Compute the probability of success for the special case when creating a GHZ state from 4 bell pairs. Requires that ancillas are on the last part of the entire state rho.

rho : (densmat) density matrix.

faulttolerance.decomposition.tools.p_success.ghz_4(rho)¶

Compute the probability of success for the special case when creating a GHZ state from 4 bell pairs. Requires that ancillas are on the last part of the entire state rho.

rho : (densmat) density matrix.

faulttolerance.decomposition.tools.p_success.single_sel(rho, N, ancillas_pos)¶

Return the success probability of the single selection protocol for entanglement distillment.

rho : (densmat) density matrix. N : (int) system size. ancilla_pos : (int) position of qubit to be measured.

faulttolerance.decomposition.tools.pauli_basis module¶

Routines to assemble the pauli basis based on constructiong the operators based on symbols (“IIXI”, “YZZX”, … )

author: Eduardo Villaseñor created-on: 18/11/17

faulttolerance.decomposition.tools.pauli_basis.char_to_operator(c)¶

Converts a character into a sigma function.

faulttolerance.decomposition.tools.pauli_basis.combinations(n_operators, ops_positions, system_size)¶

Returns all the possible operator combinations for a given number of operators and system size

n_operators : (int) number of operators in which the combinations are going to be
obtained.

ops_positions : (list) position in which each operator acts. system_size : (int) total system size.

faulttolerance.decomposition.tools.pauli_basis.get_basis(operator_positions, system_size)¶

Get all operators comninations from 0 to system_size.

faulttolerance.decomposition.tools.pauli_basis.product_rules(A, B)¶

Rulles that used in the symbol product function.

faulttolerance.decomposition.tools.pauli_basis.string_to_operator(s, positions, system_size)¶

Takes a string and returns a gate acting on the corresponding qubits. Strings example: IXZI, YYYZ, …

s : (string) string representation of single qubit operators. positions : (list) position in which each operator acts. system_size : (int) total system size.

faulttolerance.decomposition.tools.pauli_basis.symbol_product(symbolA, symbolB)¶

Do the operation of two operators in symbol form up to a -1 factor. ex. XYZZ * IXZY = XZIX

faulttolerance.decomposition.tools.pauli_basis_test module¶

faulttolerance.decomposition.tools.projectors module¶

Some tools to generate projectors based on even/odd or binary numbers.

author: Eduardo Villaseñor created-on: 18/11/17

faulttolerance.decomposition.tools.projectors.even_projectors(system_size)¶

Returns all the even projectors in the qubit basis of a given system size.

system_size : (int) total size of the system to be projected

faulttolerance.decomposition.tools.projectors.number_to_ket(system_size, number)¶
faulttolerance.decomposition.tools.projectors.numbers_to_kets(system_size, numbers)¶
faulttolerance.decomposition.tools.projectors.numbers_to_projectors(system_size, numbers)¶
faulttolerance.decomposition.tools.projectors.odd_projectors(system_size)¶

Returns all the odd projectors in the qubit basis of a given system size.

system_size : (int) total size of the system to be projected

faulttolerance.decomposition.tools.projectors.project_even(rho)¶
faulttolerance.decomposition.tools.projectors.project_even_ket(state)¶
faulttolerance.decomposition.tools.projectors.project_odd(rho)¶
faulttolerance.decomposition.tools.projectors.project_odd_ket(state)¶
